trans-unit.source: Provides style capability for the pagination UI of a page.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The PagerStyle object is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object with additional style properties specific to the pagination user interface (UI) of a form.

Use the properties and methods of the PagerStyle class to override default text for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.NextPageText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PreviousPageText%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PageLabel%2A> properties.

For example, if you are programmatically creating a form with Next and Previous links to the appropriate pages, you can override the text for these links by setting the value of the properties previously mentioned.

You can use methods, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.GetNextPageText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.GetPreviousPageText%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.GetPageLabelText%2A> to retrieve the current value of the properties.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PageLabel%2A> property applies only to HTML markup and may not be rendered in other markups such as WML.
Instantiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a formatted string for the user interface (UI) element used to navigate to the next page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.NextPageText%2A> property and the one-based current page index passed in to format the string.
Used by form adapters.
The index of the current page.
A formatted string for the user interface (UI) element used to navigate to the next page.
Returns a formatted string for the UI element used to navigate to the next page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Uses the property and the one-based current page index passed in to format the string.
Used by form adapters.
The current page index.
The page count.
A formatted string for the UI element used to navigate to the next page.
Returns a formatted string for the UI element used to navigate to the previous page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PreviousPageText%2A> property and the one-based current page index passed in to format the string.
Used by form adapters.
The index of the current page.
A formatted string for the UI element used to navigate to the previous page.
Gets or sets the label used for a UI element that is used to navigate to the next page.
The default value is "Next".
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The label can include the format specifier `{0}`, which is substituted with the page number of the next page when the label is rendered.
The label used for a UI element that is used to navigate to the next page.
Represents the key for retrieving the style from the embedded stylesheet for <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.NextPageText*>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
Gets or sets the label used for the current page.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If this property contains an empty string, no label is displayed.
The label can include the format specifiers `{0}` and `{1}`, which are substituted with the page number of the current page and the total number of pages, respectively, when the label is rendered.
For example, the format specifier `Page {0} of {1}` would show the current position within the total number of pages.
> [!NOTE] > WML devices do not render this property.
The label used for the current page.
Represents the key for retrieving the style from the embedded stylesheet for <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PageLabel*>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
Gets or sets the label used for the UI element used to navigate to the previous page.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Previous" name="Previous" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The label can include the format specifier `{0}`, which is substituted with the page number of the previous page when the label is rendered.
The label used for the UI element used to navigate to the previous page.
Represents the key for retrieving the style from the embedded stylesheet for <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagerStyle.PreviousPageText*>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
